bibl.note: This document is a letter dated August 31, 1797 from Captain William Richards to David Henley, Agent of War. Richards requests money to purchase a wagon to carry supplies for himself and his men.

div.p: I find on examination the canoe which I have hired at 1/- pr per day (as I could not purchase one under twenty dollars.) will not take all my baggage_ The spare cloathing clothing of my company and camp equipage requires a waggon wagon _ I can procure one by and with your approbation_

closer.salute:
I am with Respect Sir
Your Obedient Servant
Wm William Richard
Capt 3rd Reg. Captain 3rd Regiment
closer.add:
Four Horses yet absent_
4 wanting Shoeing_
P.S. Will you please to direct the purchase of a Lock as I cannot obtain the key of my store room_the sending after those articles would cost the United States forty dollars

p.add:
David Henley Esquire Agent of War
Serjeant McLaud
